intro: Herniaria hirsuta subsp. cinerea, commonly known as the grey hernia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the stonecress family (Brassicaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, grey-green foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by small, round capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a distinctive component of alpine and tundra ecosystems.
